intro: Eureiandra congolensis, commonly known as the Congo eureiandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in shaded, humid environments. Eureiandra congolensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
